STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 16, 2025
KAREN MARCATH
St. Joseph/Cass County DHHS
692 E MAIN ST,
CENTREVILLE, MI, 49032-9301
RE: License#: CP750201427
Dear KAREN MARCATH:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 6/13/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

Services

CENTREVILLE, MI 49032-9301
Agency Telephone #: 2694671200

children in foster home, Supervise
Independent Living

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
• (3) An agency shall record the dates and places
of contacts and persons interviewed or observed
as part of a reevaluation.
One of Six open foster home files reviewed contained a foster home evaluation
report that did not include the SOGIE of youths the family would prefer/be
unwilling to accept.
CPA Rule 400.12404 Placement
• (6) An agency must document, in the child's
record, within 7 calendar days after placement,
the information specified in R 400.12417(1) and
all the following information:
• (h) A photograph of the child at the time
of placement.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not
contain a photograph of the youth taken at the time of placement and uploaded
within 7 days.

CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:
• (f) Notification to the parents, referral
source, lawyer guardian ad litem, and
courts when applicable, of the change in
placement.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements did not contain
documentation that all required information was provided to a new caregiver prior
to a planned replacement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim 8/8/2024, CAP Approved 8/28/2024
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:
• (g) Information about the child was
shared with the new placement,
consistent with the requirements of R
400.12417.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements did not contain
documentation that all required notifications of a planned placement change were
made prior to the change.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim 8/8/2024, CAP Approved 8/28/2024
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must, include all the following:

• (f) A dental re-examination must be
obtained at least every 9 months, unless
a greater frequency is indicated.
Two of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements did not contain required
dental re-examinations.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim 8/8/2024, CAP Approved 8/28/2024
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (d) Any known history of abuse or neglect
of the child.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements did not contain
documentation the youth's history of abuse or neglect was provided to the
caregiver.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (h) Any other known information to enable
the foster parent to provide a stable, safe,
and healthy environment for the foster
child and the foster family, including
information about siblings who do not
reside in the foster home as provided in
federal law.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements did not contain
documentation the known information to enable caregiver to provide a stable
safe, and healthy environment for the child including any known sibling
information was provided to the caregiver prior to the placement.

CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (e) All known emotional and
psychological factors relating to the care
of the child.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements did not contain
documentation of known emotional and psychological factors relating to the
youth's care was provided to the caregiver.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (f) All known behaviors of the child.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements did not contain
documentation of known behaviors of the child were provided to the caregiver.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (g) Circumstances necessitating
placement or replacement of the child.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements did not contain
documentation the circumstances necessitating placement/replacement was
provided to the caregiver prior to the placement.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans

• (2) An agency shall complete written service
plans for each child and parent or parents, as
follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the
initial removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
Three of Nine open youth files reviewed (8 foster care, 1 IL) contained one
service plan completed past the due date.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the
development of service plans to enable the
parent or parents and foster parents to
understand the plan for the child and the
parents' and the foster parent's role in assisting
the agency in carrying out the plan. An agency
shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and
the child's family is confidential.
Two of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements did not contain
documentation of the PATP being provided to and discussed with the parents
and/or foster parents.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• When completing a special evaluation be sure to include all details of
interviews that relate directly to the allegation. One SER reviewed included
allegations the youth was being called names by the foster parent. The foster
parent interviews focused on the discipline methods used which did not
include name calling; however, the report did not include that the foster
parents were asked about the specific allegations.

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was 1 substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. The one SER involving substantiated maltreatment in care addressed medical
neglect of youths placed in the foster home. The report identified appropriate
interviews and document reviews to verify the results. The agency's recommendation
of revocation was appropriate based on the findings of fact.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The one
CAP submitted by the agency was in response to the 2024 licensing inspection
report dated 8/8/2024 and was approved on 8/18/2024. That CAP addressed ten
violations, three of which were policy violations no longer regulated by DCWL and
seven of which were licensing rule violation. Each of those violations were
present in either one or two files. The CAP was largely successful as evidenced by
only three of the violations addressed in that CAP being repeated this year.
During the period under review the Child Placing Agency license was closed for
the Cass County office and that office became a satellite to the St. Joseph office.
This has some impact on the comparison between the 2024 and 2025 inspections
as the 2024 inspection and CAP for the Cass County files are not represented.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment was completed on 5/19/2025 and indicated
the agency staff continue to implement strategies such as email and calendar
reminders to ensure compliance with timeframes. Placement staff are providing
required placement information/documents before placement/replacement and
checklists are being utilized to assist with ensuring all information/documents were
provided as required. The only barriers identified by the chief administrator is the
lack of residential placements and psychiatric beds for youth assessed to need
those services. The chief administrator reports a positive impact from the CAP
developed after the last licensing inspection.
Financial Overview
N/A

Staff Interviews
The staff members interviewed reported receiving good support from supervision
and co-workers. They indicate being able to access the program manager and
Director, as needed. They all stated there are good systems in place to help
manage due dates and tasks. No concerns were reported.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency office has adequate space and equipment for the delivery of foster
care, independent living, and certification services. Physical CHRI for both the St.
Joseph and Cass county families is stored securely within locked cabinets in the
licensing supervisor's office. There is a cross shredder in the office. Closed
adoption files are locked in cabinets which are located in the main office which is
only accessible by key card. The Cass County office, which is a satellite to the St.
Joseph location is currently undergoing construction.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
6/13/2025
_____________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
June 16, 2025
